definitions.definition: To render dull; to remove or blunt an edge or something that was sharp.
definitions.example: Years of misuse have dulled the tools.

definitions.definition: To soften, moderate or blunt; to make dull, stupid, or sluggish; to stupefy.
definitions.example: He drinks to dull the pain.

definitions.definition: To lose a sharp edge; to become dull.
definitions.example: A razor will dull with use.

definitions.definition: To render dim or obscure; to sully; to tarnish.
